txt.en: Instance: Will of the Stormhammer
'Aye, he was a skilled warrior. Far better than I!'
You notice Thorin has begun weeping
'Let me start by thanking Hersegg and [placeholder]...'
'It is because of them that we now speak.'
'Although Hersegg has told you of the reason for my visit, I have also come to apologize.'
'Ah, Thorin!'
'May I speak plainly, Hermáth?'
'I bid you welcome, King Under the Mountain.'
'It is about Durin...'
'But... who is this?'
'Your son, Durin.'
'When the Easterlings crossed through the Ironfold, I did what I thought was best.'
'With war at our doorstep, I ordered my son to remain within Járnfast until the battle's end.'
'You have always known wisdom beyond your years.'
'At the time, it seemed the wisest course.'
'That's enough reading for now anyway!'
'Tell me, Thorin. Do I speak falsely?'
'But as of late, I find myself questioning that decision... and ashamed of its cost.'
'I'll be just a moment, King Thorin.'
'Dry your tears, my King.'
'Like my father, your son Durin died in the defence of the Lonely Mountain.'
'Please, come!'
'Let us put this unpleasantness behind us, shall we?'
'He and so many other brave dwarves fell that Durin's Folk might endure.'
'Grandfather of Hersegg!'
'You wish for me to aid your son and his Gabil'akkâ. Is that right?'
'But then I remembered how you and father would speak when I was a boy...'
'You need only have asked.'
'You believed that your son would be Durin come again--Durin the Deathless reborn at last!'
'I will do it, Thorin.'
'Apologize? What for?'
'Of course, my King.'
'Is something troubling you?'
'I see.'
'Oh, Thorin...'
'I cannot help but see Dáin's boy behind those eyes.'
'When some mocked you as 'Stone Helm', I knew better.'
'I did not begrudge you your decisions then, and neither do I now.'
'My son Durin was a hero!'
'I mourn him as any father would, but you bear a needless burden.'
'I do not look back in anger or bitterness... but with pride.'
'Come along, [placeholder].'
'Durin was my son, and I loved him.'
'Do not mistake our sorrows for your guilt.'
'If their fates were truly wrought by the First Crafter, it would have come to pass just the same.'
'You are the King Under the Mountain!'
'But now I fear I have wrought a fate for our sons against the design of the First Crafter.'
'What would have been if my Durin joined the battle?'
'Would their fates have been different?'
Would your son have lived? Would mine have fallen in his stead?'
'You were my father's dearest friend, Hermáth.'
'And I... I have stolen from you something that can never be repaid.'
'I... have left Hersegg without a father.'
'Though not of blood, you are my kin, and I have failed you.'
'How could I dare to ask anything else of you?'
'Yes.'
'Thank you, Hermáth.'
'It is an honour to meet you, [placeholder].'
'I am Hermáth Stormhammer.'
'Hero of Azanulbizar, Keeper of Járnfast...'
'Defender of the Lonely Mountain...'
'Wielder of Theneb-adhâr, the Thunderstrike...'
'Yes, yes, Grandfather of Hersegg...'
'And Father of....'
'Bah! Just call me Hermáth.'
'I do not know what to say...'
